title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless favorite passed down through generations. Its golden, glossy filling and perfectly flaky crust make it an irresistible centerpiece for any Easter brunch or special occasion.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out dough and place it into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is golden brown and set.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving.
tips: Chilling the dough before rolling ensures a flaky crust. Avoid overbaking to keep the filling gooey but set. Use fresh pecans for the best flavor and texture.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a luscious blend of buttery crust and a rich, caramel-like filling studded with crunchy pecans. Its glossy, golden surface and nutty aroma fill the kitchen with warmth, making it a beloved classic that brings comfort and celebration to any table.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Perfectly flaky crust paired with a rich, gooey filling
  • Ideal for Easter brunch, holidays, or special family gatherings
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh pecans
  • A beautiful pie that impresses with its glossy, golden finish

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family Easter brunch, and its sweet, nutty richness instantly became a tradition. Sharing it with loved ones always sparks joy and nostalgia, reminding me of Southern hospitality and warm gatherings.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide the perfect crunch and nutty flavor essential to this pie. Choose high-quality pecans for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and depth of the filling, while a pinch of salt balances flavors.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs create a rich, tender crust and smooth filling texture, while corn syrup adds that classic glossy sweetness.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and an oven capable of precise temperature control are essential for perfect results.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly, then mix in egg yolk and ice water to form dough. Chill for at least 1 hour to ensure a flaky crust.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and place in pie plate. Layer pecans evenly, then pour filling mixture over them. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature to cook filling until golden and set, about 50 minutes total.
Finishing Touches:
Let the pie cool completely to allow the filling to firm up, enhancing slicing and presentation. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for an indulgent finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheat oven to 450°F to set the crust quickly before lowering the temperature.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling; look for a slightly jiggly center that firms as it cools.
  • Golden brown edges and a glossy top indicate the pie is ready.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for longer freshness; reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: This pie always brings back fond memories of sharing sweet moments with family during holidays. Its comforting flavors and inviting aroma make every gathering feel special and heartfelt.

Enhance this pie by adding a splash of bourbon or a pinch of cinnamon to the filling for warmth and complexity. Toast pecans lightly before baking to deepen their flavor, or sprinkle a bit of sea salt on top for a delightful sweet-salty contrast.

Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of sweet dessert wine for a perfect brunch or holiday dessert experience.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the crust with a gluten-free flour blend. Vegan adaptations can use plant-based butter and egg replacers, while maintaining the rich pecan filling. Try adding chocolate chips or swapping pecans for walnuts for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use chilled butter and ice water to achieve a tender, flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid air bubbles and cracks.
  • Bake at high heat initially to set the crust, then lower temperature to cook filling evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a shiny, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie II recipe, you’re not just baking a dessert—you’re creating a warm, inviting experience that brings smiles and sweet memories. Dive in confidently and enjoy every rich, nutty bite!
